ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Error running MixMaster after update to 1.5
ygData.msgSnippet: The problem is not in your installation, but that I forgot to change the file type in MixMaster to the new Cantera input file type. Here s the fix: run a

The problem is not in your installation, but that I forgot to change  
the file type in MixMaster to the new Cantera input file type. Here's  
the fix:

run a Python or MATLAB script to create the 3 gas mixtures as follows:

g1 = IdealGasMix('gri30.cti')
g2 = IdealGasMix('air.cti')
g3 = IdealGasMix('h2o2.cti')

Then drag the .xml files that are produced by this script (gri30.xml,  
air.xml, h2o2.xml) into the 'data' folder. This should fix the problem.

Alternatively, you can edit file  
C:\Python23\Lib\site-packages\MixMaster\MechMaster.py and change '.xml'  
to '.cti' on lines 10-13.

Dave



On Friday, September 12, 2003, at 03:04 AM, msrasmus wrote:

> Dear Dave
>
> After upgrading both my Windows and Linux distribution of Cantera, I
> get an three error messages, when I try to run MixMaster. The errors  
> are:
>  could not create gas mixuture object: gri30
>  could not create gas mixuture object: air
>  could not create gas mixuture object: h2o2
> and after clicking OK on the last error the program is terminated.
>
> Do you have an idea of whats wrong in my installation?
>
> Regards
> Martin
